descriptionMarkdown:
# Multi-signal Memory

## [Reddit Post / Video](https://www.reddit.com/r/factorio/comments/aky8l1/multisignal_memory_saves_every_signal_as_is_to/)

Stores every signal and it's value (except `S` since that's reserved as the set/save/store signal, but you can change it)

Pulsing the `S` signal stores the input value. If there is no input value it stores that (erases the memory).

Handles negative values too.

> ###### I made this based on [SafwatHalaby](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?f=193&t=60330&p=362377#p362377)s original memory design. The layout is completely the same, but instead of storing only a value for a fixed signal, it stores everything as is. And while on the original design you would use the bottom signal (Marked as `R` there) to reset the memory (erase it), here you use it for setting the memory.
title: Multi-signal Memory
